I thought I would post this message from  vagranthoo.  He figured out what the problem is so maybe it will help anyone else who has a problem like this.
--------------------------------------------------------
Subject: About the \\"This version of the program is not licensed to run on your system\\" error. 
Message:  
LOKI_LOKI, Thanks for your kindly help! Finally I got my question resolved. It\\\'s simply because I\\\'m using an Asian operating system. For more information please check out: http://www.rosettastone.com/knowledgebase/SSL/WebHelp/CD/This_version_is_not_licensed_to_run_on_your_system.htm The only difference between the so-called \\"new application CD\\" and the one you\\\'ve provided in this DVD image is the file Xtras\\\\FLTXtra.x32. Simply by replacing this file everything just works fine. If you\\\'d like to integrate it into your images I can mail this file to you. I\\\'m sorry that I just forgot the address where I had downloaded it. Thanks again for your great job! vagranthoo 
--------------------------------------------------------

Thank you for letting me know.  Hopefully this will help others.

Most of this is posted in the info section at the top for the DVD but I'll post it here again.

First off this image file was created to work on IBM compatible PC's.  There is a file located on the disk for MAC's but I can't give you any help there as I've never worked with a MAC before.

Second, the image file will either HAVE to be burned to disk or you can use a program like Alcohol120% to Mount it on a Virtual DVD drive.

The reason for this is that the Disk has to be in the drive in order for it to work and see the languages.
If you burn the image you have to remember to keep the disk handy when you want to run the program.
If you mount the image file you never have to worry about putting the disk in the drive.

The image is created so that it will Autorun on insert so it should start automatically when you put it in the drive or mount it.

Remember after it is installed the Disk has to be in the drive or mounted in order to run.

Good Luck, Hope this helps.

To answer cezen's question.  This is not a copy of the free discs.  This is a compilation that was first put together by BobbyJoe but all he did was provide the files then you had to use your tech savvy smarts to figure out how to make it work and some of the languages didn't work so what I did was tried to make it easy for people to use.  First, I fixed the languages that didn't work then I decided to put everything on 1 DVD that I possibly could then make the image file.
The reason I made the image file is quite frankly because I got tired of trying to walk people through my other upload.  People just couldn't figure it out.  There are a lot less questions here compared to the other UL.

Hey all. Go to 
http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/3865583/Rosetta_Stone_Ultimate_Language_Disk_v2.iso
You get every language in an iso file. No Extracting, all you have to do is burn it to a disc with PowerISO or Alcohol and it autostarts when you load it. You can also mount it to your virtual drive. It comes with all the help files, language sheets, and even a bonus language program. Works perfectly. I got this about a year ago and I love it.
Oh, and only 3.62 GB, so it fits perfectly on a DVD, or takes up as little space on your HD as possible. Trust me, this is the easiest way to go. I tried torrents like this, and the set up and installation alone was the biggest pain in the a...With this, no installation is needed.

The file is in ISO format. You don't have to install the program to your computer. You can use PowerISO to burn it to a disc, and it will autorun on your computer anytime after you put the disc in. Or, if you don't want to burn it, simply use the "Mount" option in PowerISO and choose to mount image to drive [E]. It should then open up the file folder with RS in it. If it doesn't, go to "My Computer", right click on your new (E) drive, and click run. That's all you have to do. Rosetta Stone will run on its own, no installation needed, no extracting files, it is all self-contained. You will see every language, all you have to do is choose one and off you go.

morrison0880,
While I appreciate your enthusiasm about other torrents it was inappropriate for you to fish for other downloaders here by posting your comment and torrent link here.  This isn't like other torrents for rosetta stone.  This is a DVD ISO image of the western languages.  There is NOTHING difficult about using this torrent more than there is with the one you posted about.  They both require the use of image mounting software or burning them to disc if you so choose.  The setup and installation is no more than having to click next all the way through the setup process.  The problem with what you are suggesting by not installing the software is that the program will not memorize what language and which lesson you left off at so you can begin at the same spot again simply by logging in to the software's interface and I use a different log in for each language I'm trying to learn so I can go back to exactly where I left off without having to try and remember where for each language.

Before you comment on someone else's torrent please try be a little more educated about the torrent instead of putting it down otherwise you run the risk of looking like an idiot.

Am I correct on that point, or Level 3 text maybe was just forgotten to be included in the information box here?

I would very much like to get Level 3 of the Latin American Spanish language as well so a short reply to this question would be again appreciated.

Thank you in advance and please keep up the good work.

/Bittornado

Bittornado,
Level 3 was not included in the previous upload.
However I can see where you might think that.
When looking at the info I posted for the other upload it looks like this:

Language		size  image files used
----------------------------------------------
Spanish (Lat Am) I	123 	3
Spanish (Lat Am) II	129	3


Only Levels 1 & 2 are listed.  Maybe you saw the 3, which is under the column for "image"
and thought that meant Level 3?  The 3 under image merely stands for the picture set
which is used for that particular language.  It is because a lot of the languages share the same picture
set that makes it possible for them to all be put on a DVD like this.

I'll have to get back to you about Level 3.  I'm not sure if I have level 3 for version 2 of the software.
